data.title: Hugh Keays-Byrne dead: How did Hugh Keays-Byrne die? Cause of death
data.meta_description: HUGH KEAYS-BYRNE has died aged 73, the actor was best known for his role in Mad Max.
data.text:
Actor Hugh Keays-Byrne has died at the age of 73, it has been confirmed. Keays-Byrne was perhaps best known for his portrayal of Toecutter in the 1979 film Mad Max. He later returned to the franchise as Immortan Joe in Mad Max: Fury Road in 2015. The star had a career spanning since the 1970s with roles across cinema and the small screen.

How did Hugh Keays-Byrne die?

He died on Tuesday (December 2) and no cause of death has been given.

Express.co.uk will update this article when more information is available.

Keays-Byrne's death was announced by filmmaker Brian Trenchard-Smith in a heartfelt Facebook post, which read: "I am sad to report that our friend Hugh Keays-Byrne passed away in hospital yesterday.

"A former Royal Shakespeare Company actor who settled in Australia co-starred in my Man From Hong Kong, and achieved world wide recognition as the Toecutter in Mad Max, and Immortan Joe in Mad Max-Fury Road.

"This photo reflects the innate sense of humor he brought not only to my film but every production he worked on. He was a fine actor and a good friend to Margaret and myself for 46 years.

"We spent many happy Sunday mornings with him, his partner Christina, and a group of fellow actors and artists (the Macao Light Company) at the house they shared in Centennial Park.

READ MORE: Hugh Keays-Byrne dead: Mad Max: Fury Road actor dies aged 73

"Christina, Jack, Shawn, Tim , Ralph, Robina, our hearts go out to you.

"Hugh had a generous heart, offering a helping hand to people in need, or a place to stay to a homeless teenager.

"He cared about social justice and preserving the environment long before these issues became fashionable.

"His life was governed by his sense of the oneness of humanity. We will miss his example and his friendship. Vale, Hugh."

Mad Max: Fury Road actress and Oscar winner Charlize Theron took to social media to pay tribute to the actor, tweeting a photo from the movie set of herself with the late star.

She captioned the image, which she shared with her 867,000 followers: "RIP Hugh Keays-Byrne Itâ€™s amazing you were able to play an evil warlord so well cause you were such a kind, beautiful soul. You will be deeply missed my friend."

Fans have taken to Twitter to pay tribute to the actor, with one sharing a photo of Keays-Byrne in his younger years.

He said: "Remembering Aussie actor Hugh Keays Byrne who has sadly passed away at 73. RIP Mate."

Another fan said: "Rest In Piece [sic] Hugh Keays Byrne, May your soul ride with thunder and lightning to the pearly gates of Valhalla."

A third said: "The Tragedy of One of the Best Actor's Hugh keays-byrne Death has left a deep wound in Our heart's. You are always loved & never forgotten. Rest in Power & Peace ! Amen ! [sic]."

Born in India to British parents, Keays-Byrne and his family later moved to England where he grew up.

The star later moved to Australia in the 1970s after starring in a production of A Midsummer Night's Dream took him Down Under.
